body: @ijuma : I am working to remove the duplication. Stay tuned.
Tests pass locally
We need to backport this to the 0.9.0 branch as well.
lgtm
Merged to trunk.
LGTM. Merged to trunk.
@ewencp As discussed, I removed abort() and changed WorkerSinkTaskThread to allow the exception to propagate to ShutdownableThread.

The Kafka config parsing code already seems to trim white spaces. See - https://github.com/apache/kafka/blob/trunk/clients/src/main/java/org/apache/kafka/common/config/ConfigDef.java#L197
Not sure why do we need to trim again.

Issue 3050 affected 0.8.2.1 version. This code fixed bug on that branch, but no new release planned for 0.8.2 so I pushed it to master. With this config, in master this doesn't seem to have sense. Should I push it to that branch?

I see similar code (trim) in 0.8.2.1 as well.
https://github.com/apache/kafka/blob/0.8.2.1/clients/src/main/java/org/apache/kafka/common/config/ConfigDef.java#L143

Maybe its failing in some other code path ? I am not able to replicate that issue by adding space after the hostname.
Try to replicate it in 0.8.2.1 branch, for me without that trim it throws exactly the same exception as Navin reported in jira.
yes, it fails in 0.8.2.1 branch. apparently it was not trimming all the values, but seems to have got fixed in the trunk.
LGTM -- tests pass locally and the failure in Jenkins looks unrelated.

Looks good, passes locally. 

Not expecting anything new, but branch builder is running here:
http://jenkins.confluent.io/job/kafka_system_tests_branch_builder/338/

LGTM. I agree with the approach. 

Just a small comment regarding docs.

Also, sounds like we want it in 0.9.0.1 branch too?
@ijuma I removed most duplication. About Future-based API for zookeeper, that sounds good but seems beyond the scope of this JIRA.
@junrao if you have a chance could you have a look? Thanks.

@ymatsuda Ping for review.

Fixed unit test by adding an option to disable retaining duplicates through seqnum (this is required for aggregation).
LGTM overall.
Good catch, and thanks for the patch @xiaotao183 . LGTM and merged to trunk and 0.9.0.
Thanks for the patch. LGTM

@ijuma LGTM wrt replacing the code for renaming files. But also want to revisit discussion around fixing tests related to classes that were deleting files in constructors -- no longer sure we've got a complete fix.

@auradkar, @jjkoshy  : I had a look. One way to trigger the original test to fail consistently is to set the logging to TRACE in test.resources.log4j.properties. The new test passes, however the code is out of date with the recent trunk at this point. Could you resolve the conflicts if you get a chance?

@ewencp Thanks for the review. I replied to your comment in the "files changed" tab. My take is that this is OK as it is provided that `TestUtils.tempDir` does what it's supposed to do. And we have KAFKA-2718 to make sure that's the case (the code looks fine, but there are is some unexplained behaviour in some Jenkins test runs).

could add a config item at `server.properties` and `zookeeper.properties` ?  

It's same with redis config file . Maybe looks better :)
@granders there were some failures in the branch builder. Are they related?

Thanks for the patch @atulsm. It looks good. I think the config item that @darionyaphet suggested can be discussed separately since it is a more substantial change (it modifies existing behavior).

Do you mind opening a JIRA, so this change can make it to our release notes?
Cool, that all makes sense. LGTM!
Thanks @hachikuji , merged to trunk and 0.9.0.
LGTM :)
LGTM
Thank you for contributing, @tgravescs
LGTM. The build failure is on unrelated issue.

@ijuma 
There were 2 failures, but as far as I can tell they seem unrelated:

This failed, but also failed on trunk on 1/17/2016, so I believe it is unrelated

```
Module: kafkatest.tests.zookeeper_security_upgrade_test
Class:  ZooKeeperSecurityUpgradeTest
Method: test_zk_security_upgrade
Arguments:
{
  "security_protocol": "SASL_PLAINTEXT"
}
```

This also failed 

```
Module: kafkatest.tests.benchmark_test
Class:  Benchmark
Method: test_consumer_throughput
Arguments:
{
  "security_protocol": "SSL"
}
```

Failure was due to a parsing error (parsing statistics choked on a `NotLeaderForPartitionException`), but the same test with `"interbroker_security_protocol": "PLAINTEXT", "security_protocol": "SSL"` passed. If the failure was due to Ewen's change, I would have expected it to fail on `"interbroker_security_protocol": "PLAINTEXT"` as well.

Running again here:
https://jenkins.confluent.io/job/kafka_system_tests_branch_builder/341/
lgtm
Merged to trunk. Left built-in aggregate implementations will be submitted in a different PR.

@ewencp @gwenshap All tests passed:
http://confluent-kafka-branch-builder-system-test-results.s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/2016-01-18--001.1453165281--ewencp--kafka-3080-system-test-console-consumer-version-failure--0f0d33f/report.html

@darionyaphet  & @gwenshap . Thanks for your suggestions.

I have created JIRA https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/KAFKA-3119 for this. I am not able to assign this issue to my name though.

Thanks for the patch. Thinking a bit more. It seems the main issue is that the reporting interval is based on messages, instead of time. Reporting the stats at some fixed time interval is more intuitive and is also used in org.apache.kafka.tools.ProducerPerformance. So, to be consistent, we probably should just change the reporting interval to time.
Thanks @atulsm. I'll assign the JIRA to you. Can you please edit the issue title to replace MINOR with KAFKA-3119? It makes the automated merging a bit easier on me :)
@gwenshap Sure, i have already renamed the pull request name to contain the JIRA.
Perfect. LGTM.
Merged. Thank you for your contribution!
@gwenshap Thanks for the review. I update the documentation to have its own section with notable 0.9.0.1 changes.
LGTM

LGTM. 

Thanks for fixing this!

Thanks for the patch. Just a high level comment. Should we step back and take a holistic approach to changing all ZK accesses in the controller to use the raw ZK client api? This is because (1) We also identified an issue (KAFKA-3083) related to the controller soft failure, which potentially requires direct access to raw ZK client api to fix; (2) We probably don't want to make the controller code more complicated by having it to deal with both sync and async mode.

This may take a bit more effort. However, it will move the controller to a state that we ultimately want. We can't immediately remove the dependency on ZKClient due to the scale consumer. However, we can at least change all the ZK usage in the broker to use the raw ZK client api and leave the ZK usage in the scala consumer untouched.
Thanks for the catch @dajac , just wondering where in your code did you call `sizeInBytes` (currently it is only triggered in `RecordAccumulator`)?

@guozhangwang I'm was playing with Records/MemoryRecords in the context of KAFKA-2066. Test failure doesn't seem related to this.

BTW, I would be interested to have your opinion on KAFKA-2066 (see comment in the ticket)
LGTM, merged to trunk and 0.9.0.
Thanks @granders. It would be great to get this in @gwenshap as it fixes a bunch of system test failures.
thanks @gwenshap

@junrao agreed, I also think it is much better to make it uniform. one clarification: would you keep using the synchronous api or move to the asynchronous api? if we move to the asynchronous api, then dealing with this present issue would be simple.
LGTM. Merged to trunk.
LGTM. Merged to trunk and 0.9.0

@ewencp I have addressed your points. Now, version is explicitly handled and an exception is thrown if the version is not supported. I'm just wondering if throwing an exception is the best way especially when `sendResponseCallback` is called from the purgatory. Also, I have updated `ProduceRequest.getErrorResponse` to handle version 0 and 1.

Thanks for the feedback. If I understand correctly your suggestion is to change the implementation of the argument "reporting-interval" so instead of number of messages in each interval it takes the (perhaps minimum) length of intervals in milliseconds. It seems that this change could impact both kafka.tools.ConsumerPerformance and kafka.tools.ProducerPerformance as they both use kafka.tools.PerfConfig to extract the args. Do we want kafka.tools.ProducerPerformance modified to time-based intervals too?
Wouldn't it be nice to have metric per topic partition, in how many different racks do ISRs live?

I made some minor changes so the reporting interval for ConsumerPerformance becomes time-based. Although kafka.tools.ProducerPerformance indirectly uses PerfConfig it does not implement similar interval reporting and will be unchanged.
LGTM. Nice catch!
Tests passed locally.
Can we please close this PR since ZK authentication was integrated via #303?
The contribution is my original work and that I license the work to the project under the project's open source license.
Thanks for the patch. Could you change the title of the PR to lead with "KAFKA-3112: "? A unit test would be great too.
Done & done.  There's also a test in KafkaProducerTest which goes through this code.
LGTM. Merged to trunk and 0.9.0.
I have rebased and addressed all the comments.

Thanks. I think we should actually remove host.name and advertised.host.name in favour of listeners and advertised.listeners as the former assume a PLAINTEXT security protocol and it's been a source of mistakes.
It's so nice to get your reply. I'm so glad you agree with that.
LGTM
LGTM. It would be great to get this in.

Yes, the patch only improves the performance of electing new leaders. However, it will be useful to improve the performance in other places as well. For example, when the controller fails over, the first thing that it does is to read all existing topic/partitions from ZK. Using the async api there will speed up controller failover. So, perhaps moving completely to the async api will be better since it gives better performance and makes the code more uniform? However, we probably should look at all ZK usage in controller to make a call on that.
We should also be sure to update this wiki https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/KAFKA/Kafka+data+structures+in+Zookeeper with the new broker version.

A recent patch in trunk added a "Notable changes in 0.9.0.1" section to [upgrade.html](https://github.com/apache/kafka/blob/trunk/docs/upgrade.html#L51) could this just be added to that list?

Otherwise LGTM.

Also noting this change looks to be very similar/duplicate to [KAFKA-2657](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/KAFKA-2657) with #336. Closing one should resolve the other. I have linked them in Jira.

Given that the period for all of these tasks is configurable, I can't see an issue for making the initialDelay configurable, but I don't know the history. 

@Mszak How are you setting the value in your tests? Since this is for testing purposes, you could also override the passed in `Scheduler` ([KafkaScheduler](https://github.com/apache/kafka/blob/trunk/core/src/main/scala/kafka/utils/KafkaScheduler.scala#L118)) to ignore the initial delay.

Can you change the title of the PR to include "MINOR: "?

Just a few small comments otherwise it looks good.
LGTM. Thanks for the unit tests.

Looks like it was added to trunk via  #785 here [zookeeper-server-start.sh](https://github.com/apache/kafka/blob/trunk/bin/zookeeper-server-start.sh#L19)

Could you close this PR?
